mods.abstract: A RUNAWAY IN JAIL. WAS committed into the Jail of the Parish of St. Landry, on the 8th February instant, 1855, a negro-boy, named ETIENNE, aged about 15 years, five feet, six inches high, speaking french and english. Said boy says he belongs to Mr. Carlos Grevemberg, living in the Parish of St. Landry, from whom he ranaway about five or six days ago. The owner of this slave is requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges, and take him away, otherwise he will be dispsoed of according to law. LOUIS L. BOUTTE, Jailor. Opelousas, February 10th, 1855

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
